output.heading: 1Online Eiffel documentation
output.paragraph:
Congratulations for installing ISE Eiffel 5, featuring
tools/eiffelstudio/index.html EiffelStudio ,the full-lifecycle environmentfor quality software development, based on themost advanced version of object technology andthe concepts of Design by Contract.
ISE Eiffel 5 is available on many platforms and is one of thefirst development environments to take advantage of the Microsoft.NET framework.

ISE Eiffel 5 comes with extensive online documentation. Please takethe time to read up on Eiffel and the
tools/eiffelstudio/index.html EiffelStudio environment to makethe best possible use of the environment. Here is your roadmap to Eiffel documentation.
2Release notes
You will find out
tools/eiffelstudio/reference/02_what_s_new/Eiffel54.html here what's new in this release.
2General documentation Make sure to read the introductory documentation,which includes:
Two presentations of the Eiffel method and language, one short(
general/guided_tour/language/invitation-00.html "an invitation to Eiffel" )and the other a
general/guided_tour/language/tutorial-00.html detailedtutorial .
An in-depth, step-by-step
general/guided_tour/environment/index.html Guided Tour of EiffelStudio .Highly recommended to master the environment's powerful toolsfor analysis, design, implementation, browsing, incremental compilation(the Melting Ice technology), debugging, documentation, HTMLgeneration, metrics, cross-generation of C packages etc.
Complementary documents:
general/guided_tour/other/why_eiffel.html "Why your next project should use Eiffel" and the
general/guided_tour/other/one_minute.html "1-minute summary" (to show your boss!).
You will find the introductory documentation
general/guided_tour/index.html here .
2Environment documentation
tools/eiffelstudio/index.html EiffelStudio is the centerpiece of ISE Eiffel 5, your friendlyenvironment for conceptualizing, analyzing, designing, producing,documenting, debugging, exploring, measuring and maintaining systems.You will find
tools/eiffelstudio/index.html EiffelStudio documentation
tools/eiffelstudio/index.html here .
2Library documentation
ISE Eiffel is all about reuse. Thousands of reusable componentshelp you develop your applications by standing on the shouldersof previous developers. Here is the documentation on the principallibraries:
libraries/base/index.html EiffelBase : ISE's acclaimed open-source librarycovering the fundamental algorithms and data structures ofcomputing science.
libraries/vision2/index.html EiffelVision 2 : the extensive multi-platform graphicallibrary for producing modern GUI applications that will run onWindows as well as Unix, Linux, VMS and other X-based platforms.
libraries/wel/index.html WEL (Windows Eiffel Library) : powerful graphicallibrary for Windows platforms.
libraries/com/index.html EiffelCOM : your tool of choicefor building and using Microsoft COM components.See also
tools/wizards/com/index.html EiffelCOM Wizard .
libraries/net/index.html EiffelNet : the client-server library for exchangingobject structures across the network, between identical or differentmachine architectures.
libraries/time/index.html EiffelTime : time and date library.
libraries/store/index.html EiffelStore : object-relational database interface library.
libraries/thread/index.html EiffelThreads : multi-threading library.
libraries/eiffel2java/index.html Eiffel2Java : Java interface library.
libraries/web/index.html EiffelWeb : Web interface library with support foreasy development of CGI scripts in Eiffel.
libraries/lex/index.html EiffelLex and EiffelParse : lexical analysis and parsing libraries.
2Documentation on other tools
See also the documentation on the following tools of ISE Eiffel 5:
tools/wizards/com/index.html EiffelCOM Wizard : generates a COM clientor server application, taking care of all the details.
tools/eiffelbuild/index.html EiffelBuild : a GUI builder for the
libraries/vision2/index.html EiffelVision 2 library.

paragraph.output:
1Online ENViSioN! Documentation
Congratulations for installing Eiffel ENViSioN! ENViSioN! is a product of Eiffel Software Inc. ENViSioN! is Eiffel for . NET for Visual Studio . NET.
ENViSioN! gives software developers the ability to create software using the Eiffel method and language in combination with the with Microsoft Visual Studio .NET IDE. As you read this documentation, you will find that Eiffel provides capabilities that make it unique among the many .NET compatible languages. Eiffel is a full-lifecycle methodology and language for quality software development, based on the most advanced version of object technology and the concepts of Design by Contract. Eiffel Software's Eiffel is available on many platforms and is one of the first development environments to take advantage of the Microsoft .NET framework. ENViSioN! comes with extensive online documentation. Please take the time to read the documentation included with ENViSioN! so that you can make the best possible use of the language, methodology, and environment. Here is your roadmap to Eiffel documentation.
2General documentation Make sure to read the introductory documentation, which includes:
Two presentations of the Eiffel method and language, one short (
general/guided_tour/language/invitation-00.html an invitation to Eiffel ) and the other a
general/guided_tour/language/tutorial-00.html detailed tutorial .
Complementary documents:
general/guided_tour/other/why_eiffel.html "Why your next project should use Eiffel" and the
general/guided_tour/other/one_minute.html "1-minute summary" (to show your boss!).
2Library documentation
Eiffel is all about reuse. Thousands of reusable components help you develop your applications by standing on the shoulders of previous developers. Here is the documentation on the principal libraries:
libraries/base/index.html EiffelBase : Eiffel Software's acclaimed open-source library covering the fundamental algorithms and data structures of computing science.
libraries/vision2/index.html EiffelVision 2 : the extensive multi-platform graphical library for producing modern GUI applications that will run on Windows as well as Unix, Linux, VMS and other X-based platforms.
libraries/wel/index.html WEL (Windows Eiffel Library) : powerful graphical library for Windows platforms.
